episodeTitle: Reunited with Dark King Rayleigh! Decision Time for Luffy!
episodeTitleJapanese: 冥王レイリーとの再会 ルフィ決断の時
episodeTitleRomanized: Meiō Reirī to no Saikai - Rufi Ketsudan no Toki
description: Rayleigh arrives at Amazon Lily after swimming through the Calm Belt, reuniting with Luffy and Jinbe. He returns Luffy's straw hat and reveals that Kuma deliberately sent Luffy to Amazon Lily to protect him. Rayleigh offers to train Luffy to prepare him for the New World. Meanwhile, Usopp struggles on the Boin Islands, desperately trying to escape the carnivorous plants despite Heracles' warnings.

events.title: Rayleigh Encounters Heart Pirates in Calm Belt
events.description: The Heart Pirates encounter Silvers Rayleigh emerging from the Calm Belt after he fought and killed a Sea King. Rayleigh asks Law if Luffy is on the island after seeing the straw hat.
events.significance: This marks Rayleigh's arrival at Amazon Lily to find Luffy and begins the crucial post-war planning phase for the Straw Hat Pirates.

quotes.speaker: Rayleigh
quotes.context: Rayleigh asks Law about Luffy's whereabouts after seeing the straw hat

events.title: Heart Pirates Depart Amazon Lily
events.description: Law and the Heart Pirates depart from Amazon Lily in their submarine after treating Luffy. Law reflects that he cannot wait to see what trouble 'D' will cause in the future.
events.significance: Marks the end of Law's immediate involvement in Luffy's recovery and foreshadows his interest in the Will of D.

quotes.text: I cannot wait to see 'D' causing trouble again.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law's reflection on Luffy as the Heart Pirates depart

events.title: Hancock's Marriage Fantasy
events.description: Boa Hancock fantasizes about marrying Luffy, imagining him as her husband using her fingers and hugging her bosom. Nyon lectures her about marriage, explaining that Luffy's hug at Marineford did not constitute a marriage proposal.
events.significance: Provides comedic relief and reinforces Hancock's deep romantic feelings for Luffy, a recurring character trait.

quotes.text: What would I have to do to have a proper marriage ceremony?
quotes.speaker: Boa Hancock
quotes.context: Hancock asks Nyon about marriage after the misunderstanding is cleared up

events.title: Luffy and Jinbe Meet Rayleigh
events.description: Jinbe carries Luffy on his back as they search for Law and his crew, but instead encounter Silvers Rayleigh. The reunion marks a crucial turning point in Luffy's journey.
events.significance: This meeting sets the stage for Rayleigh's training offer and Luffy's two-year timeskip, fundamentally changing the course of the series.

events.title: Rayleigh Returns Luffy's Straw Hat
events.description: Silvers Rayleigh returns Luffy's iconic straw hat to him, the symbol of his promise to Shanks and his identity as a pirate. This emotional moment represents Luffy reclaiming his resolve after the trauma of losing Ace.
events.significance: The straw hat is the most important symbol in One Piece, representing Luffy's promise to Shanks, his dreams, and his journey. Its return signifies Luffy beginning to heal and move forward.

quotes.text: Here, I believe this belongs to you.
quotes.speaker: Rayleigh
quotes.context: Rayleigh returns the straw hat to Luffy

events.title: Rayleigh Befriends Hancock and Her Sisters
events.description: Rayleigh meets Boa Hancock and her sisters (Sandersonia and Marigold) and quickly befriends them. He shows respect and kindness to the Kuja warriors and the Snake Princess.
events.significance: Rayleigh's friendship with Hancock helps facilitate Luffy's training arrangement and shows his diplomatic nature.

events.title: Rayleigh Explains Kuma's True Intentions
events.description: Rayleigh reveals through flashback that Bartholomew Kuma disclosed his membership in the Revolutionary Army during the battle at Sabaody Archipelago. Kuma deliberately sent Luffy to Amazon Lily and later gave Rayleigh a clue about Luffy's location, knowing he didn't have much time left before losing his consciousness.
events.significance: This revelation recontextualizes Kuma's actions at Sabaody, showing that he was protecting the Straw Hats rather than destroying them. It's a crucial piece of information about Kuma's sacrifice.

quotes.text: Kuma told me he was a member of the Revolutionary Army. He deliberately sent you here to Amazon Lily, knowing you would be safe.
quotes.speaker: Rayleigh
quotes.context: Rayleigh explains Kuma's actions to Hancock and the others

events.title: Rayleigh Offers to Train Luffy
events.description: Rayleigh explains that he cannot simply return Luffy to Sabaody Archipelago because Luffy would face the same dangers that nearly destroyed the Straw Hats. Instead, Rayleigh offers to train Luffy to become strong enough to survive the New World.
events.significance: This is one of the most pivotal moments in the series, setting up the two-year timeskip where Luffy will learn Haki and become exponentially stronger. This training is essential for the Straw Hats' survival in the New World.

quotes.text: I cannot bring you back to Sabaody Archipelago. You would suffer the same fate. But I have an offer for you - let me train you.
quotes.speaker: Rayleigh
quotes.context: Rayleigh proposes training Luffy instead of returning him to his crew immediately

events.title: Usopp's Desperate Escape Attempt on Boin Islands
events.description: On the Boin Archipelago, an overweight Usopp desperately attempts to escape the island and reunite with his crew despite Heracles' objections. Usopp gets sucked into the island's carnivorous mouth but is rescued by Heracles.
events.significance: This scene shows Usopp's determination to return to Luffy despite his physical condition and the dangers. It parallels the other Straw Hats' struggles and desire to reunite.

quotes.text: I have to get back to Luffy! I can't abandon my captain!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp's declaration of loyalty as he tries to escape the island

events.title: Heracles Rescues Usopp
events.description: Heracles rescues Usopp from being consumed by the carnivorous Boin Island, demonstrating the mentor-student relationship that will develop between them during the timeskip.
events.significance: Foreshadows Heracles teaching Usopp about Pop Greens and combat techniques during the two-year training period.

quotes.text: I cannot wait to see 'D' causing trouble again.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law's reflection on Luffy as the Heart Pirates depart

quotes.text: Kuma told me he was a member of the Revolutionary Army. He deliberately sent you here to Amazon Lily, knowing you would be safe.
quotes.speaker: Rayleigh

quotes.text: I cannot bring you back to Sabaody Archipelago. You would suffer the same fate. But I have an offer for you - let me train you.
quotes.speaker: Rayleigh

quotes.text: I have to get back to Luffy! I can't abandon my captain!
quotes.speaker: Usopp

themes.description: The episode establishes the mentor-student relationships between Rayleigh and Luffy, and Heracles and Usopp, setting up the two-year training period.
themes.symbolism: The return of the straw hat symbolizes Luffy reclaiming his identity and being ready to grow stronger.

themes.description: Kuma's actions are revealed to be protective rather than destructive, showing his sacrifice to save the Straw Hats.
themes.symbolism: Kuma's deliberate choice to send Luffy to Amazon Lily represents his selfless dedication to protecting the next generation.

themes.description: Despite their separation and hardships, the Straw Hats remain loyal to each other and determined to reunite, as shown by Usopp's desperate escape attempts.
themes.symbolism: Each Straw Hat's struggle on their respective islands mirrors their dedication to their captain and crew.

characterSpotlights.development: Rayleigh takes on the role of mentor to Luffy, offering to train him for the New World. He shows wisdom, kindness, and understanding of what Luffy needs.
keyActions: Swims through Calm Belt after killing a Sea King
quotes: I cannot bring you back to Sabaody Archipelago. You would suffer the same fate. But I have an offer for you - let me train you.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy receives his straw hat back and begins to face the reality of what he must do to protect his crew - become stronger.
keyActions: Searches for Law and the Heart Pirates

characterSpotlights.development: Hancock continues to show her romantic feelings for Luffy through comedic fantasy sequences, while also hosting and supporting him during his recovery.
quotes: What would I have to do to have a proper marriage ceremony?

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp demonstrates his unwavering loyalty to Luffy despite his physical condition and the dangers of the Boin Islands.
keyActions: Declares he cannot abandon his captain
quotes: I have to get back to Luffy! I can't abandon my captain!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded Hancock's marriage fantasy scene with additional visual comedy not present in the manga.
The anime showed more detail of Rayleigh swimming through the Calm Belt and fighting the Sea King.

trivia.fact: This episode marks a crucial turning point in the series, setting up the two-year timeskip that fundamentally changed One Piece's story structure.
The episode aired on July 17, 2011, during the Post-War Arc, which ran from episodes 493-516.
The opening theme 'Fight Together' by Namie Amuro was specifically chosen for the Post-War Arc to reflect the themes of moving forward despite loss.
This episode corresponds to Chapter 591, pages 2-16. The remaining pages of Chapter 591 were adapted in Episode 510.
